english_translation: Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ prohibited me from reciting while bowing and while prostrating. He said: "When you bow, glorify Allah the Mighty and Majestic, and when you prostrate, glorify Him." From Zayd ibn Ali (may Allah be pleased with him), he used to say in the bowing: "Glorified is my Lord the Mighty," and in the prostration: "Glorified is my Lord the Most High." Zayd ibn Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) said: If you wish, say it nine times, and if you wish, seven times, and if you wish, five times, and if you wish, three times. And it was said that when he raised his head from bowing, he said: "Allah heard the one who praised Him. Our Lord, all praise is for You."

english_translation: Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with him): When he performed the tashahhud, he would say: "All greetings, good prayers, blessed ones coming morning and evening, pure ones, pleasant ones, flowing ones are for Allah. Whatever is good and pure, sacred and sincere, and grows is for Allah. Whatever is foul is not for Allah. I bear witness that there is no god except Allah alone with no partner for Him. I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and His messenger, whom He sent with truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner, and a caller to Allah by His permission and an illuminating lamp. I bear witness that you are a good Lord, and that Muhammad is a good messenger." Then he would praise Allah and exalt Him, and pray for the Prophet ﷺ. Then he would greet on his right side and on his left side, saying: "Peace be upon you and the mercy of Allah. Peace be upon you and the mercy of Allah."
